text.div:
GenomicsReporting

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/genomics-reporting/ImplementationGuide/hl7.fhir.uv.genomics-reporting

Guidelines for reporting of clinical genomics results using HL7 FHIR

name: GenomicsReporting
title: Genomics Reporting Implementation Guide
publisher: HL7 International Clinical Genomics Work Group
description: Guidelines for reporting of clinical genomics results using HL7 FHIR

grouping.name: General Profiles
grouping.description: General constraints on FHIR resources to be adhered to as part of the CG implementation guide that apply regardless of what area(s) of genomics are of interest

grouping.name: Implications
grouping.description: Profiles needed for linking genomic findings to knowledgebases for diagnostic or therapeutic use

grouping.name: Abstract
grouping.description: Abstract profiles holding common properties, outlining similarities in implementable profiles

grouping.name: Extensions
grouping.description: Extensions defined as part of the CG implementation guide

grouping.name: Code Systems
grouping.description: Code Systems defined in this implementation guide

grouping.name: Value Sets
grouping.description: Value Sets defined in this implementation guide

grouping.name: Concept Maps
grouping.description: Concept Maps defined in this implementation guide

grouping.name: Operations
grouping.description: Operations defined in this implementation guide

grouping.name: Examples
grouping.description: Examples showing the use of the CG profiles

grouping.name: Structures: Extension Definitions
grouping.description: These define constraints on FHIR data types for systems conforming to this implementation guide

grouping.name: Terminology: Value Sets
grouping.description: These define sets of codes used by systems conforming to this implementation guide

grouping.name: Terminology: Code Systems
grouping.description: These define new code systems used by systems conforming to this implementation guide

grouping.name: Example: Example Instances
grouping.description: These are example instances that show what data produced and consumed by systems conforming with this implementation guide might look like

resource.name: Request for Genomics Test
resource.description: The lab order or request that triggered the execution of the genomics test

resource.name: Specimen
resource.description: Constraints on Specimen for use with clinical genomics reporting

resource.name: Genomics Report
resource.description: Defines the overall genomic report

resource.name: Region Studied
resource.description: Provides a description of the region studied.

resource.name: Grouper
resource.description: Organizes information within a genomic report

resource.name: Overall Interpretation
resource.description: Provides a coarse overall interpretation of the genomic results reported.

resource.name: Haplotype
resource.description: Assertion of a particular haplotype on the basis of one or more variants

resource.name: Genotype
resource.description: Assertion of a particular genotype on the basis of one or more variants or haplotypes

resource.name: Variant
resource.description: Details about a set of changes in the tested sample compared to a reference sequence.

resource.name: Sequence Phase Relationship
resource.description: Indicates whether two entities are in Cis (same strand) or Trans (opposite strand) relationship to each other

resource.name: Tumor mutation burden
resource.description: Tumor mutational burden (TMB), also known as mutation load.

resource.name: Microsatellite instability
resource.description: Microsatellite instability (MSI) is the condition of genetic hypermutability (predisposition to mutation) that results from impaired DNA mismatch repair (MMR).

resource.name: Diagnostic Implication
resource.description: Profile with properties for observations that convey the potential impact of genomic characteristics on a diagnosis

resource.name: Therapeutic Implication
resource.description: Profile with properties for observations that convey the potential impact of genomic characteristics on a medication or non-medicinal therapy.

resource.name: Medication Usage Task
resource.description: Task describing what sort of change (if any) should be made in a patient's medication based on an identified finding

resource.name: Recommended Followup
resource.description: Task describing the followup that is recommended

resource.name: Genomics Base
resource.description: Base profile that defines characteristics shared by all genetic observations.

resource.name: Genomic Finding
resource.description: Properties common to genomic findings whose results are expressed as computable discrete elements (e.g. genotypes, haplotypes, variants, etc.)

resource.name: Genomic Implication
resource.description: Abstract profile for observations linking a genomic finding to an external knowledgebase.

resource.name: Related Artifact
resource.description: Captures citations, evidence and other supporting documentation for the observation or report

resource.name: Recommended Action
resource.description: References a proposed action that is recommended based on the results of the report or observations

resource.name: Supporting Information
resource.description: Additional information relevant to interpreting/understanding the report

resource.name: Condition Inheritance Pattern
resource.description: A set of terms that describe the transmission pattern of a condition in a pedigree.

resource.name: Risk Assessment Reference
resource.description: Extension reference to RiskAssessment resource

resource.name: Example Task - PGxRecEx01
resource.description: For clopidogrel, individuals with this diplotype are expected to have significantly reduced platelet inhibition, increased residual platelet aggregation and increased risk for adverse cardiovascular events in response to clopidogrel. Alternative antiplatelet therapy (if no contraindication) is recommended. Refer to current guidelines for dosage and recommendations at https://cpicpgx.org/guidelines/guideline- for-clopidogrel-and-cyp2c19/

resource.name: Example Task - PGxRecEx02
resource.description: voriconazole - An alternative agent that is not dependent on CYP2C19 metabolism such as isavuconazole, liposomal amphotericin B, or posaconazole is recommended as primary therapy in lieu of voriconazole. A lower than standard dosage of voriconazole with careful therapeutic drug monitoring is another alternative. Refer to current guidelines for dosage and recommendations at https://cpicpgx.org/guidelines/guideline-for-voriconazole-and-cyp2c19/.

resource.name: Example Task - PGxRecEx03
resource.description: For citalopram, a 50% reduction in starting dose is recommended with therapeutic drug monitoring to guide dose adjustment or select an alternate drug not predominantly metabolized by CYP2C19. Refer to current guidelines for dosage and recommendations at https://cpicpgx.org/guidelines/guideline-for-selective-serotonin-reuptake-inhibitors-and-cyp2d6-and-cyp2c19/. If CYP2D6 genotyping is available, refer to the current guidelines for dosing recommendations.

resource.name: Example Task - PGxRecEx04
resource.description: For escitalopram, a 50% reduction in starting dose is recommended with therapeutic drug monitoring to guide dose adjustment or select an alternate drug not predominantly metabolized by CYP2C19. Refer to current guidelines for dosage and recommendations at https://cpicpgx.org/guidelines/guideline-for-selective-serotonin-reuptake-inhibitors-and-cyp2d6-and-cyp2c19/. If CYP2D6 genotyping is available, refer to the current guidelines for dosing recommendations.

resource.name: Example Task - PGxRecEx05
resource.description: For amitriptyline, a 50% reduction in starting dose is recommended with therapeutic drug monitoring to guide dose adjustment. Refer to current guidelines for dosage and recommendations at https://cpicpgx.org/guidelines/guideline-for- tricyclic-antidepressants-and-cyp2d6-and-cyp2c19/. If CYP2D6 genotyping is available, refer to the current guidelines for dosing recommendations.

resource.name: Condition Inheritance Pattern
resource.description: Value Set for specific ttransmission patterns of a condition in a pedigree

resource.name: Functional Effect
resource.description: The effect of a variant on downstream biological products or pathways.
